comments:
1. I import several large project using Import from file system into my    
   workspace.
2. Validators such as HTML validator process begin to run.

3. I decide to delete all the projects.

4. The projects are deleted but many exceptions as the following are being thrown :
*** ERROR ***: Thu Jun 21 15:51:53 IDT 2007    org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Resource '/test_remote_multi_cvs(PlayGround)_3/phpBB2-cvs2/templates/subSilver/groupcp_user_body.tpl' does not exist.
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.checkExists(Resource.java:310)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.checkAccessible(Resource.java:193)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.createMarker(Resource.java:637)
    	at org.eclipse.wst.validation.internal.TaskListUtility.addTask(TaskListUtility.java:81)
    	at org.eclipse.wst.validation.internal.operations.ValidationOperation$2.run(ValidationOperation.java:1744)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1797)
    	at org.eclipse.wst.validation.internal.operations.ValidationOperation$1.done(ValidationOperation.java:1767)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobListeners$3.notify(JobListeners.java:39)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobListeners.doNotify(JobListeners.java:112)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobListeners.done(JobListeners.java:152)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.endJob(JobManager.java:550)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.WorkerPool.endJob(WorkerPool.java:105)
    	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:71)

Is seems that I managed to delete these files before the validator reached them
and now, when they do not exist the validator fails.

I suggest the following patches :
1) org.eclipse.wst.validation.internal.TaskListUtility, line 62
   add || !resource.exists() to the "IF" statement to verify that 
   the file really exists.
2) org.eclipse.wst.validation.internal.ValidatorMetaData, line 349
   add && ((IFile)resource).exists() . Again, to verify that the file 
   really exists.

I just check and it fixes the error exception that was thrown.

Yaron
